title: Tent
technology: Swift, JavaScript, MapKit, Firebase, Google Photos, Google Cloud Functions, iOS
description: Mobile Application where you capture and share images and drawings with people near you
description2: Front-End uses SwiftUI for the application, backend uses Google Firebase and Cloud Functions for user authentication, location verification, database, and data storage. Not yet released on the app store.

title: Stock Market Simulator
description: Website that creates sessions of a stock market environment where users can trade stocks
description2: Group Project where I worked on creating responsive user interfaces with react and material-ui with state management through redux, Developed system to create artificial trade orders to influence the market depending on trends.

title: Polydrive.io
description: HTML5 multiplayer game that takes advantage of WebSockets to provide real-time gameplay between many clients

title: Digit Drop
technology: Unity2D, C#, GameKit, AdMob, iOS, Android
description: Mobile Game where players add numbers to match the given number at the top.
description2: Built with Unity2D with C#, integrated with Apple's Game Center and Google Play Game Services to manage leaderboards. Released in 2017

title: Time Flux
description: Mobile game where you tap the screen to match the arrow with the correct time at the top.
description2: Built with Unity2D with C#. Released in 2016

title: Two Arrows
description: iOS game where the user would match falling arrows by tapping on each side of the screen.
description2: Written in Objective-C using the Cocoas2d game engine, Previously released on the iOS app store in 2015.

title: Perimeter The Game
description: iOS game where the objective is to tap on the screen when the two perimeters overlap.

title: Lava River
description: The floor is lava! Tap on the rocks to move forward in the game!
description2: Written in Objective-C with Apple's SpriteKit game engine, Released in 2014.

title: Feed The Bear
description: iOS app where the goal is to tap on the bears while the fish fall.
description2: Written in Objective-C with Apple's SpriteKit game engine, Previously released on the iOS app store in 2014.

title: Single Cycle CPU
description: Final Project for Computer Organization class
description2: Culmination of work done in this class to build a Single Cycle CPU written in VHDL and simulated in ModelSim.

title: Recycle NYC
description: A visualization project for a Data Visulization class to see relation between NYC recycling practices and its demography.
description2: Group Project where I worked on creating the map visuzalization using d3.js and displaying the data on top of the geography.
